page.title: 13 LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Summary of chat with Miss Walker about old Brassington. Brassington was a self-sufficient community until after World War 2. Tradesmen until the War were : Joiners & Wheelwrights -Ouslam & Fearn Smithy - Joe Taylor 2 Bootmakers - G.H.Walker & J.Mellor Butcher - J.W.Spencer 3 Grocers - T Brindley & J. Allsop Green grocer - F.Stevenson Wireless,Electric & Bicycle parts - E.F.Taylor Chip Shop - Castledine Newsagent - Yates Coal Merchant 2 dressmakers - Mrs.Seals & Miss Dale Villagers bought milk direct from local farms. Today - 1 General Store - T.M.Grindey Post Office - B.Bigland, Coal Merchant Jeffrey Walker, Milkman - D.Seal
